posts.content:
Hi there.

First of all, thanks for all the work you do here. You really inspire a lot of player and help them to survive even in the direst nwn servers!

I was looking for a nice lolth priest build.

Looking around this forum I found some idea that could be nice, for instance the Sehanine's Finest build (Cleric 15/Bard 2/Arcane Archer 23) seems to suits well with an elf (drow) character. But I'm not sure if it fit the idea of a drow priest keeping aways while shooting... maybe, maybe.

Other nice build (IMHO) is the Last Rites (Cleric(16), Assassin(22), Shadowdancer(2)), but assassination seems to male-drow work business, and the build is created for a human character (for me, the best race, but role playing is roleplaying).

That's why I'd like to ask you about a cleric drow build able to survive the underdark, from level 1 to 40 (the server is Ethernan, extremely hard enviroment specially for evil people like drows, duergars and minos). My previous experience teachs me that a very well desing character is needed to avoid constant death.

The race information is, of course:

Ability adjustments: +2 Dex, +2 Int, +2 Cha, -2 Con
Darkvision: Drow can see in the dark.
Sleeplessness: Immune to spells and effects of the sleep subtype.
Hardiness vs. enchantments: +2 racial bonus on saving throws against mind-affecting spells.
Iron will: +2 racial bonus on will saving throws.
Skill affinity (listen): +2 racial bonus to listen checks.
Skill affinity (search): +2 racial bonus to search checks.
Skill affinity (spot): +2 racial bonus to spot checks.
Keen senses: Drow make active search checks automatically and with no movement penalties.
Spell resistance: Innate spell resistance of 11 plus 1 per level.
Light blindness: Abrupt exposure to light blinds a drow for 1 round. In addition, drow suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, saves and checks while operating in bright light.
Spell ability - darkness: Can cast darkness once per day at third level.
Spell ability - faerie fire: Can cast faerie fire once per day at third level.
Elven: Drow are considered elven for the purpose of spells.
Predilect class: wizard for male, priest for female.
Short sword proficiency
Light crossbow proficiency
Level adjustment +2

Best regards!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey, man!

As the author of Sehanine's Finest, I have to say that the build itself is more of an archer than a proper priest. It doesn't cast much, uses DEX instead of WIS as the sniping stat and has 23 AA levels. Yes, AB and Damage should be very high with Imbue Arrows + Divine Favor, but it's just not that much of a priestess.

I have two builds that can fulfill the role of a full-power priestess with really good sniping prowess:

Speedy Sniper

or

Demolition Man

The first is a sniper that utilizes the synergy of Zen Archer and Cleric casting stat being Wisdom to be a very good caster while remaining a competent sniper. It's built to make use of Expeditious Retreat stacking with Monk Speed removing the speed cap. You can truly run like crazy for a few seconds after you get Monk 3 and 1st level Wizard spells.

The second one is a powerhouse Zen Archer / Caster with 38 Cleric levels and 38 final unbuffed Wisdom. The first version is more of a sniper, and further down the topic you will find a more caster-oriented version of the build. You can actually do anything inbetween those two to make it suit your environment, in other words, tweak to taste.

Take it EZ!

By "common classes", I guess you mean base classes. That really ties our hands for power-building.
How about almost the same build, but pure Cleric, with Blind Fight instead of Rapid Shot, which doesn't work for crossbows? I don't know why a pure Cleric would be more powerful than a Cleric / Monk. I was thinking more of a Cleric 38 Monk 1 Assassin 1 for RP. You could even sacrifice one Great Wisdom feat for Cleric 35 Monk 3 Assassin 2 to have Uncanny Dodge and keep your DEX bonuses to AC That would cost you one AB but would also open a feat for you to take Extend Spell.

You should avoid close combat with Called Shot, True Seeing and a summoned creature to tank for you. However, sometimes it's unavoidable. In that case you're better served with a GMW'd Darkfired Kama with 7 attacks per round. The problem is that the natural armor items are all amulets, which is also the slot you use to equip periapts of Wisdom. If your server has other Wisdom-enhancing items that occupy other slots, then that is droppable.

I would personally forget about Animal domain. I'd choose between Travel (if there is no perma-haste), Trickery (for Improved Invisibility, which gives you concealment against archers), Strength (for 2 levels of Divine Power and Stoneskin) or War (for Cat's Grace to increase your AC when you take the first Monk level and Aura of Vitality, to increase DEX and CON by 4 each for your toughest battles). I advise you against going pure Cleric, You can go Cleric 38 / Monk 1 / Assassin 1 or Cleric 35 / Monk 3 / Assassin 2 to be more Drow-RP friendly. Lawful Evil could mean you're loyal to Llolth, right?

EDIT: just read your new findings. That sucks, huh? OK, Sehanine's Finest is the way to go then. Good news is that it's pretty competent in melee too.

Take it EZ!

*** Drow elves:
Ability adjustments: +2 Dex, +2 Int, +2 Cha, -2 Con (already included)
Darkvision: Drow can see in the dark.
Sleeplessness: Immune to spells and effects of the sleep subtype.
Hardiness vs. enchantments: +2 racial bonus on saving throws against mind-affecting spells.
Iron will: +2 racial bonus on will saving throws.
Skill affinity (listen): +2 racial bonus to listen checks.
Skill affinity (search): +2 racial bonus to search checks.
Skill affinity (spot): +2 racial bonus to spot checks.
Keen senses: Drow make active search checks automatically and with no movement penalties.
Spell resistance: Innate spell resistance of 11 plus 1 per level.
Light blindness: Abrupt exposure to light blinds a drow for 1 round. In addition, drow suffer a -1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, saves and checks while operating in bright light.
Spell ability - darkness: Can cast darkness once per day at third level.
Spell ability - faerie fire: Can cast faerie fire once per day at third level.
Elven: Drow are considered elven for the purpose of spells.
Predilect class: wizard for male, priest for female.
Short sword, rapier and light crossbow proficiency and focus.
Level adjustment +2

New changes:
No more crossbows: The reason is that there is no good ammunition in the server, so only arcane archers are good at ranged combat.
Spell penetration: In the underdark almost every creature has a high magic resistance.
Scribe scrolls: Another server feature. There're no potions but the ones you create on a workshop, so they are extremly expensive and rare. The paper, on the other hand, is easy to create and a relative common item.
Magic domain: Lolth tends to get angry and refuses to give clerical spells (roleplaying). Magic domain is suppose to reflect the small magic training that a Priestess may have to survive in these kind of situations.
